Posts.Content: Thank You Newporter, Monday, I'll make a call to my current Dr. and see if she has all my old records. By the way, was born in Modesto, raised in Santa Rosa, have family all over CA. Been in the Memphis, TN area since the early 70's. Dave
Posts.Title: High PSA and enlarged Prostate!!

Posts.Content: WOW!!!!!! Didn't expect this at all!! Monday morning at 9am, my dr called me at home with the lab reports. Called me in for: BICALUTAMIDE 50 MG, ONE A DAY).. Cancer has spread into my Fat tissue around my prostate (BAD). "FREE PSA" isn't a factory now... all 12 cores high volume and cancer is very aggressive. 5 gleason are 4+5=9; 2 4+4=8, 2 3+5=8; 2 4+3=7 (one not showing any scores just: atypical small acini). Yesterday, I Had bone scan and CT. Getting results and treatment plan this afternoon. Yesterday, Dr told me I had a T3 score. Will try to update this evening.
Posts.Title: High PSA and enlarged Prostate!!

Posts.Title: High PSA and enlarged Prostate!!

Posts.Content: Thank You Newporter, Monday, I'll make a call to my current Dr. and see if she has all my old records. By the way, was born in Modesto, raised in Santa Rosa, have family all over CA. Been in the Memphis, TN area since the early 70's. Dave
Posts.Title: High PSA and enlarged Prostate!!

Posts.Content: Hi, My name is Dave, will be 62 next month. Sept. 10 went to my primary Dr. for annual check up. Also, told me about a prostate test. I said yes as I don't think I've ever had one (my wife said I had one several years ago). The Dr. office call me the next day, PSA was 126. They had already made me an appointment for the next day (Wed., Sept 12th) to see an Urologist. 9-12-2012; While at the urologist office, they drew blood, Dr. did the prostate DRE test. He said my prostate was enlarged 4X the normal size. While in the office, he scheduled me for a biopsy for the following Wed. 9-19-2012. He called me the next day (Thursday, 9-13-2012) told me my psa level was now up to 128. Next Wed. (10-03-2012), I go see him for the lab results. I'm a very patient person and my wife and I have been through a lot in our 42 years of marriage (All we can say is: God has been so good to us). The pass few weeks, been having sore lower back, right hip\butt\upper leg and ribs have been sore at times. Getting up at least once a night, frequent need to urinate and at times, painful or burning sensation during urination. I've been on this site the past couple days and really like it. So tired of the wait. Any information or advice would sure be helpful. Thanks, Dave
Posts.Title: High PSA and enlarged Prostate!!

Posts.Content: Fairwind, Thank You, I'll do that.

Posts.Content: Chuck, Thank You very for all your help and taking the time to reply to my post. I don't know the PSA level from years back. Don't know of any family history of PC. Dave

Posts.Title: High PSA and enlarged Prostate!!

Posts.Content: Hi Gimmy, Sorry to hear about your story. I was too, diagnosed with agressive advance prostate cancer (Gleason 9 and STAGE 4). October 3, 2012.Dr. told me I had 4-5 years at the most to live. WOW… Oct. 3, 2012, my nurse gave me a double injection of Firmagon (Degarelix) and was to get a single injection every 28 days starting Nov. 2, along with a shot of Xgeva. He also had me to start taking 800-1000 IU/day of Vitamin D and 1200 MG of Calcium. Continue eating healthy and exercise. Sept. 12, 2012, starting out with a PSA of 128, as of Jan. 22, is down to 0.2, great. You can read my story as it would take a while to re-type it. Oct. 1st, I also started taking Casodox 50MG a day. I'm also taking Morphine SULf 30mg X2 a day (past week, cut that in half to see how my pain level is, seems to be working (most of the time)!! WE CAN BEAT THIS!!! Praying for you and your family. Dave (grandpaof4)
Posts.Title: Am I dying?

Posts.Title: Five years in the zero club

Posts.Content: Great news! So glad you're doing great! Enjoy life with your wife! Dave in Bartlett, TN
Posts.Title: Five years in the zero club

Posts.Content: Hello Lee, So sorry you have to be here, but you're among great knowledgeable friends! I see you're in the Memphis area! My wife and I have lived in the Bartlett area since 1982 (love Bartlett)! Since your status has changed, it's a good idea that your seeing a medical oncologists. Starting out, I was sent to a urologists from my primary doctor (PD) in Sept. of 2012. Jan. of 2014, I switch to my current medical oncologist at West Cancer Clinic (Dr. Sylvia Richey). October 1, 2012, I was diagnosis with Advance Prostate Cancer (Adenocarcinoma) high volume, very VERY aggressive metastatic (in my bones), Stage 4! My PSA was 130 and Gleason score 9. Numerous skull lesion most prominently on my right occipital lobe (skull); cervical spine particularly and thoracic spine, multiple ribs; fourth vertebral and my T12 vertebral was eaten up with cancer and I had to have 10 rounds of radiation and surgery (11-6-2012) to rebuild my T12 vertebral. My urologist told me that I had four to five years at best! 10-1-12, I started hormone therapy: I started Bicalutamide (Casodex) 50 mg daily and on 10-3-12, had my first monthly injection of Firmagon and Xgeva. Per my urologist, first told me the first line of defense of hormone therapy would only last 6-18 months before having to go to something stronger! MY WIFE, FAMILY AND I, WERE DEVASTATED to say the least!! As of today, I’m still on my first line of defense and my PSA is <0.064!! Having several bulged disc, my pain doctor has found the right combination of medicine to allow the pain in my lower back, right hip/butt to be manageable! During my journey with PCa, I've put my faith in God, a positive attitude, my doctors and medicine. Maybe we can meet soon! I'll keep you and your family in my thoughts and prayers! Dave, in Bartlett, TN
Posts.Title: Roller Coaster Getting Bumpy last few weeks

Posts.Content: Hello Lee, So sorry you have to be here, but you're among great knowledgeable friends! I see you're in the Memphis area! My wife and I have lived in the Bartlett area since 1982 (love Bartlett)! Since your status has changed, it's a good idea that your seeing a medical oncologists. October 1, 2012, I was diagnosis with Advance Prostate Cancer (Adenocarcinoma) high volume, very VERY aggressive metastatic (in my bones), Stage 4! My PSA was 130 and Gleason score 9. Numerous skull lesion most prominently on my right occipital lobe (skull); cervical spine particularly and thoracic spine, multiple ribs; fourth vertebral and my T12 vertebral was eaten up with cancer and I had to have 10 rounds of radiation and surgery (11-6-2012) to rebuild my T12 vertebral. My urologist told me that I had four to five years at best! 10-1-12, I started hormone therapy: I started Bicalutamide (Casodex) 50 mg daily and on 10-3-12, had my first monthly injection of Firmagon and Xgeva. Per my urologist, first told me the first line of defense of hormone therapy would only last 6-18 months before having to go to something stronger! MY WIFE, FAMILY AND I, WERE DEVASTATED to say the least!! As of today, I’m still on my first line of defense and my PSA is <0.064!! Having several bulged disc, my pain doctor has found the right combination of medicine to allow the pain in my lower back, right hip/butt to be manageable! During my journey with PCa, I've put my faith in God, a positive attitude, my doctors and medicine. Maybe we can meet soon! I'll keep you and your family in my thoughts and prayers! Dave, in Bartlett, TN
Posts.Title: Roller Coaster Getting Bumpy last few weeks

Posts.Content: Dear Kim, I'm so sorry you have to be in this forum and glad you found us! You've been given a lot of great advice and suggestions this morning and hopefully when your husband has more test completed, you both will start to put things in order and understand what you need to do to start the fight! You're not alone here and keep us update as much as you possibly can. Feel free to ask for our email/phone number if you see you or your husband need to chat or talk! I'm doing very well as you can see when you read the rest of my post! This will take time to absorb so just take it one day at a time and TAKE DEEP BREATHS!! October 1, 2012, I was diagnosis with Advance Prostate Cancer (Adenocarcinoma) high volume, very VERY aggressive metastatic (in my bones), Stage 4! My PSA was 130 and Gleason score 9. My urologist told me that I had four to five years at best! 10-1-12, I started hormone therapy: I started Bicalutamide (Casodex) 50 mg daily and on 10-3-12, had my first monthly injection of Firmagon and Xgeva. Per my urologist, the first line of defense on hormone therapy would only last 6-18 months before having to go to something stronger! MY WIFE, FAMILY AND I, WERE DEVASTATED to say the least!! Having several bulged disc, my pain doctor has found the right combination of medicine to allow the pain in my lower back, right hip/butt to be manageable! During my journey with PCa, I've put my faith in God, a positive attitude, my doctors and medicine. I'll keep you and your husband in my thoughts and prayers! Dave
